column3: Despite continued asking over the decades, so-called 'Icelandic Dick' Phillips claimed all the photos and  rock samples collected on the 1958 trip were "lost in the post". They only emerged once photographer Raymond Bottomley dies and Bernard Heath in a care home, 60 years later. Where did Ron acquire the slides and photos taken by, but denied to Raymond Bottomley...

There is a folder containing letters, newspaper clippings, accounts of supplies etc for the organising of this trip. This was before Ron was involved. It is such a shame that this video was not made when Raymond Bottomley and Bernard Heath were still alive.
Ron is a legend
Ron, and his like, are the true pioneers and heroes of cycling to me. From a fellow Ron I salute you and you have inspired a misanthropic 62 year old. Chapeau.
amazing
absolutely beautiful <3
Chapeau. So so good.
Simply beautiful.  A peaceful, quiet life, well lived.  Indeed a great way to spend a life :-)
The power and persistence of the human spirit is an incredible thing!

How was the reliability of tires way back then?  Were they built more robustly than they are now?  It seems like people are flatting at least 4x per Rapha ride, but that would have killed everyone in that 1958 attempt, let alone the 1933 attempt.
Oh, and I would love to have done the one in 1957. The rest sound a little too cold for me!
